sentences.english: Loudly in cases of life of the people on board the boating shore, let the police check.
sentences.chinese: 繼宗高聲命船上的人把船泊岸，讓警察上船檢查。

sentences.english: Love speaks up louder, and immobility itself becomes spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 愛情要高聲，靜止本身要壯觀。

sentences.english: “When someone speaks in a loud tone, girls interpret it as yelling, ” Chadwell says.
sentences.chinese: 當人們高聲說話時，女孩會用叫喊打斷他。

sentences.english: The ass felt quite proud. He lifted his voice_and_brayed, but then everyone knew him.
sentences.chinese: 驢感到很得意，他高聲地嘶叫，卻被人認了出來。

sentences.english: He gave me a huge hug, jumped on me and started screaming profanities .
sentences.chinese: 他用力擁抱了我，跳到我身上開始高聲叫罵。

sentences.english: My brother-in-law said loudly, to bother you.
sentences.chinese: 高聲說我的小舅子，勞你費心了。

sentences.english: in Nucla they crowd the counter and talk loudly about health problems.
sentences.chinese: 在紐克拉他們圍着櫃檯高聲談論健康問題。

sentences.english: Young boys in plastic sandals called out in high, hoarse voices, selling skewers of goat meat.
sentences.chinese: 穿着塑料拖鞋的男孩們用粗啞的聲音高聲叫賣羊肉串。

sentences.english: Australian kingfisher having a loud cackling cry.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞高聲大叫的翠鳥。

sentences.english: She waved the knife at me and screamed, as if possessed.
sentences.chinese: 她向我揮舞着刀，並高聲尖叫，象着了魔似的。

sentences.english: Old Zhou shouted to them to get out quickly and climb up into trees.
sentences.chinese: 老周高聲叫他們快出來爬到樹上去。

sentences.english: They have cackled on for hours.
sentences.chinese: 他們高聲談笑了好幾個小時。

sentences.english: The democratic constitution, then loudly decried by many people, was abolished.
sentences.chinese: 民主憲法，被衆人高聲撻閥直至遭到廢止。

sentences.english: The cat loudly told the tiger who watched under the tree helplessly.
sentences.chinese: 貓高聲告訴樹下無奈的老虎。

sentences.english: Standing on the stage,he rolled out his address of welcome.
sentences.chinese: 他站在舞臺上高聲致歡迎詞。

sentences.english: The company commander roared his command.

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to cry out in alarm or surprise
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
